message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Cardiovascular disease is the most common cause of death among patients on chronic hemodialysis, accounting for about 50% of deaths. While hyperkalemia and infection can be complications of CKD and hemodialysis, they are not the most common cause of death. Stroke is also a common complication but not the most common cause of death.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Cardiovascular disease is the leading cause of death in patients on chronic hemodialysis, followed by infection and stroke. Hyperkalemia is a potential complication but not the most common cause of death.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among options, the most common cause of death among patients on chronic hemodialysis is cardiovascular disease, which is a common complication of CKD and also exacerbated by hemodialysis itself. While hyperkalemia and infection can be serious complications of hemodialysis, they are not the most common cause of death. Stroke may occur in patients with CKD, but it is less common than cardiovascular disease.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Cardiovascular disease is the most common cause of death in patients on chronic hemodialysis, followed by infectious complications. Hyperkalemia and stroke are potential complications but not the most common cause of death.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, cardiovascular disease is the most common cause of death among patients on chronic hemodialysis. While hyperkalemia and infection are potential complications, they are not the most common cause of death. Stroke is also a concern, but cardiovascular disease encompasses a broader range of complications that can lead to death.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Chronic kidney disease patients are at a high risk of cardiovascular disease, and this risk increases with the initiation of hemodialysis. Therefore, cardiovascular disease is the most common cause of death among patients on chronic hemodialysis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Cardiovascular disease (CVD) is the most common cause of death among patients on chronic hemodialysis. Hypertension is a risk factor for CVD, and the patient in the question stem has CKD secondary to uncontrolled hypertension. While hyperkalemia can be a complication of CKD, it is not typically a cause of death in patients on chronic hemodialysis. Infection is also a risk in this population, but it is not as common a cause of death as CVD or stroke.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among patients on chronic hemodialysis, the most common cause of death is cardiovascular disease due to the high prevalence of comorbidities such as hypertension and diabetes. While hyperkalemia and infections can occur in hemodialysis patients, they are not the most common cause of death.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among patients on chronic hemodialysis, the most common cause of death is cardiovascular disease. This is likely due to the high prevalence of hypertension and other cardiovascular risk factors in this population, as well as increased inflammation and oxidative stress associated with CKD. While stroke and infection are also common complications in ESRD, they are not typically the primary cause of death. Hyperkalemia can be a serious complication of CKD and ESRD, but typically does not directly cause death in these patients.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among patients on chronic hemodialysis, cardiovascular disease is the most common cause of death, followed by infection, then stroke, and hyperkalemia. This patient has CKD and will eventually need hemodialysis, hence it is important to be aware of the most common causes of death in these patients.
